children.subject:
I haven't taken 61c/186/170 so I can't really provide a definitive answer to your question. But as someone taking 70 and stat 134 concurrently, I don't think 134 will be that much of a hassle for you. The entire first half of a class would be a review of 70 material, and the second half, although dense, moves fairly slowly (at least so far). Honestly I kinda took the two together on a whim, but I don't thinking taking both of them makes sense, especially if you're taking them one after another. 

I'd look at ee126 if you really want to do a probability course (it has the added benefit of being better-taught than 134), or maybe consider taking 186/61c/170.

I agree with previous anon, 134 won't be hard if you've done cs70. I would look at 126 which would focus more on cs applications of statistics.

61C is foundational for a lot of classes, such as 162 and 184. It is also supposed to be a prerequisite for 186, so I would take it before 186, but 186 is completely doable without 61C. It just adds more context so you would get more out of the class.

history.content: Which of the two is more doable or if I have done 61a,61b,70 by then? Is 170 + 61C too much? I'm thinking about taking 61C because 61C is the foundation of many upperdiv classes? Is that true?
history.subject: 170 + 61C + Stats 134 OR 170 + 186 + Stats134?
